doc:
Don Steele https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Don_Steele 0 Don Steele (born Donald Steele Revert; April 1, 1936 – August 5, 1997) was one of the most popular disc jockeys in the United States, from the middle of the 1960s until his retirement (for health reasons) in May 1997. He was known as "The Real Don Steele," a name given to him by his program director, Steve Brown, in Omaha, Nebraska, who hoped the moniker would click with listeners and make him stand out from other radio personalities. Don_Steele ( born Donald_Steele_Revert ; April_1_,_1936 – August_5_,_1997 ) was one of the_most_popular_disc_jockeys in the_United_States , from the_middle of the_1960s until his_retirement ( for health_reasons ) in May_1997 . He was_known as " The_Real_Don_Steele , " a_name given to him by his_program_director , Steve_Brown , in Omaha , Nebraska , who hoped the_moniker would_click with listeners and make him stand out from_other_radio_personalities .
